Table containing all the features used in the study with relative description

# Additional Precisions on Eye-tracking Metrics and Preprocessing {#app:et-metrics}

Conversion table in a shared format for all datasets

Computations in Table \@ref(tab:et-corpora):

- mean sent length is in # of tokens

- number of tokens with whitespace tokenization

- unique types by removing punctuation from whitespace-tokenized tokens

Once again, gaze metrics are averaged across participants. Let $A = A_1, \dots, A_{n_i}$ be the participants annotating a sentence $s = x_1,\dots,x_m$ with gaze metrics (e.g. $G^1_{A_1}(x_1)$ is the value of the first gaze metric, for example first fixation duration, for the first annotator over the first token of sentence $s$) missing durations due to skipping are replaced with the minimum available value across all annotators
